Category API Endpoints

  • Docs
  • Guides
  • Advanced Configuration
  • Category API Endpoints

An API endpoint is a point at which an application program interface (API). APIs work by sending requests for information from a web application or web server and receiving a response. These are the endpoints used for Categories.

Category Endpoints

This endpoint will return an array of each category in a given account.

  • Content-Type: application/json
  • Accept: application/json
  • Authentication: {USER_TOKEN}

An example of this can be seen below: 

[
  {
    "categoryId": 1,
    "userId": 1,
    "title": "Business Expenses",
    "description": "Expenses for the business",
    "icon": "shop",
    "totalExpense": 329.0
  },
  {
    "categoryId": 2,
    "userId": 1,
    "title": "Food & Drinks",
    "description": "All food and drinks",
    "icon": "cutlery",
    "totalExpense": 87.42
  },
  {
    "categoryId": 3,
    "userId": 1,
    "title": "Utilities",
    "description": "A list of monthly utility expenses such as water, electricity, etc.",
    "icon": "tool",
    "totalExpense": 209.63
  }
]

This endpoint will return a singular category entity based on the defined {Category_Id}.

  • Content-Type: application/json
  • Accept: application/json
  • Authentication: {USER_TOKEN}

An example of this can be seen below: 

{
    "categoryId": 1,
    "userId": 1,
    "title": "Business Expenses",
    "description": "Expenses for the business",
    "icon": "shop",
    "totalExpense": 655.0
}

This endpoint will create a new category entity based on the payload. The body of the request must be JSON.

  • Content-Type: application/json
  • Accept: application/json
  • Authentication: {USER_TOKEN}

An example of the body can be seen below: 

{
    "title": "Utilities",
    "description": "A list of monthly utility expenses such as water, electricity, etc.",
    "icon": "tool"
}

When a category is successfully created, it will return the following response: 

{
  "categoryId": 7,
  "userId": 1,
  "title": "Utilities",
  "description": "A list of monthly utility expenses such as water, electricity, etc.",
  "icon": "tool",
  "totalExpense": 0.0
}

This endpoint will update an existing category entity based on the defined {Category_Id} and payload. The body of the request must be JSON.

  • Content-Type: application/json
  • Accept: application/json
  • Authentication: {USER_TOKEN}

An example of the body can be seen below: 

{
    "title": "Utilities",
    "description": "A list of monthly utility expenses such as water, electricity, etc.",
    "icon": "tool"
}

When a category is successfully updated, it will return the following response: 

{
  "success": true
}

This endpoint will delete an existing category entity based on the defined {Category_Id}.

  • Content-Type: application/json
  • Accept: application/json
  • Authentication: {USER_TOKEN}

When a category is successfully deleted, it will return the following response: 

{
  "success": true
}

Category Objects

The Overview page contains 3 main sections which is the Categories section, the Expenses section, and the Category Breakdown section.

To learn more about each section, select it from the menu below:

Attribute Type Description Example
categoryId Integer The categoryId is a unique id used to index each category. This is generated by the system. 53
userId Integer The userId is a unique id associated with each user. This is added by the system. 42
title String The title is a 20 character string used as the title of a given category. "Utilities"
description String The description is a short couple sentence that describes the category in 255 characters "A category for all general utilities"
icon String The icon is a minimalistic icon that will represent the category. "tool"
totalExpense Float The totalExpense is the total of all expenses in the category. This is generated by the system. "Utilities"
